ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: David could try to be more willing to let student's ideas develop a little more before critiquing them.
I believe this course represents an outdated and inflexible approach to entrepreneurship that could actually be detrimental to students hoping to start an enterprise

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Team environment. Learning to manage expectations and delegation

This class is all about putting together a business plan for seeking investment. David and Maureen have a wealth of knowledge and love to share it. As long as you keep an open mind and remain flexible, you will learn tons from this class. I am going on to actually start the business we worked on in this class, and the help from Maureen and David has been immensely useful in starting up and securing funding.
Very practical material
Having Maureen and David to coach us through the process of developing a business model was extremely helpful.
Building on your own business idea/plan
Access to instructors' contacts and networks
You actually create something tangible that you care about, is interesting to you, and might actually affect what you do in the near future. At the least you learn things that are important to you.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: A little more direction and encouragement regarding applying to competitions. More presentation and public speaking practice.

The course is designed for traditional start-up stage ventures, specifically in the Silicon Valley style of rapid growth, low-cost companies. Companies that are not built for rapid scaling and growth, or that require high capital costs, are less likely to benefit from this class.
Some elements need to be updated. For example, most PE/VCs do not look at a company's business plan anymore
The terms negotiations assignment was a little slap-dash; could be explained to students better and have more direction given.
None

Needs to be updated to reflect modern entrepreneurial realities: 25 page business plan ("the book") is rarely required; capital structure can and often should focus on non-VC funding; not all businesses need to exit; the 20 year old powerpoints with stupid sound effects are terrible; better explanation of financial model; guest speakers would be nice;

I think there are 2 main areas that could be improved: 1) I think the structure of the class is very much designed for a particular type of start-up, in the VC mold of extremely rapid growth, like a new app would want. It doesn't really fit for a company that would rather be a non-profit or slower growing socially minded business. 2) I'm not convinced that this kind of business plan is the most current way of starting a business. There are probably many ways that the class could be modernized.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: It was effective

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I am interested in entrepreneurship and this provides an first-hadn opportunity to delve in it.

This course will help you understand the ins and outs of starting a business, seeking and negotiating for funding and how to write for business audiences. These are useful skills for anyone interested in business, even if you are not an enterpreneur.
Perfect for those interested in learning business skills to start your own entrepreneurial business
I am hoping to develop entrepreneurial enterprises and this did not add to my knowledge or skillset.
If you want to be an entrepreneur and/or work at start-ups like I do, then this class is a must take.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I am hoping to start an environmentally-focused business and wanted to develop important skills before going out and actually starting the business. I feel much more prepared now than before I took the class.
I'm interested in social entrepreneurship and this course seemed like it would give me a more firm basis in what it takes to start a business.
To learn how to start a business - form the business plan, raise money, etc
To get the "Yale" version of entrepreneurship; MGT 655 was much better suited to that
See question 17

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Most of them were met. I wish there would have been more practice regarding presentation and public speaking.
Above and beyond. The skills learned in this class have been the most applicable skills I have learned in any of my Yale courses.
Yes
Yes
No. I went through a much more dynamic and realistic entrepreneurial training program while in undergrad, this was a waste of time
Yeah

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: It is great to have other eyes and hands to help get your plan written, revised, and polished. You will benefit greatly from having an open mind and open ears, as our peers and professors are highly knowledgable and can really help hone your ideas and get them ready for the real world.
Good to move the project along, but a disadvantage since everyone is depending on you to do the work
Advantages: forced to deal with navigating complex interpersonal relationships and personality mismatches Disadvantages: the same
Getting everybody on the same page. Giving everyone similar amounts of work, and people doing what they're best at is tough. So much work goes into this course that you need a good team though.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Choosing your team is everything. Then, believe in the process.

Take it even if you aren't sure you want to start a business at some point in your life. You will learn valuable skills and develop an understanding and respect for what it takes to get a business off the ground. You will also develop an incredible amount of knowledge in the field your business is starting in.
Be willing to put in the work. You get the most out of it that way.

You get out of this course what you put in. Our group went on to win the Sabin prize and are going on to start a real business, other groups lost interest in their projects half way through the course. It's all about the effort you're willing to put in.
Definitely take this if you are considering starting a business but have little knowledge about how to do so......
Go through YEI or MGT 655
Do it.
